member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavCopyBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Copy Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_COPY
- When the COPY method has completed processing it MUST have created a consistent namespace at the destination. However, if an error occurs while copying an internal collection, the server MUST NOT copy any resources identified by members of this collection (i.e., the server must skip this subtree)
For example, if resource /a/b/c/d.html is to be created and /a/b/c/ does not exist
MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(DavCopyResponseCode.Conflict)
Returns DavCopyResponseCode.Created or DavCopyResponseCode.NoContent when successful

member.remarks: RFC2518 Compliant

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavCopyBase.DavCopyResponseCode.Created

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavGetBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Get Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#rfc.section.8.4
- If the requested resource does not exist the method MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(ServerResponseCode.NotFound)
Returns DavGetResponseCode.Created when successful

member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#rfc.section.8.4
- If the requested resource does not exist the method MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(ServerResponseCode.NotFound)
Returns ServerResponseCode.OK when successful

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Lock Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_LOCK
- The scope of a lock is the entire state of the resource, including its body and associated properties. As a result, a lock on a resource MUST also lock the resource's properties. For collections, a lock also affects the ability to add or remove members. The nature of the effect depends upon the type of access control involved.
Returns DavLockResponseCode.OK when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Resource Lock Framework Base Class

member.summary: Add a resource to the error list

member.summary: Occurs when the server is requesting a lock refresh

member.remarks: The returned object is readonly

member.name: P:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.ResponseLock
member.remarks: The values will be defaulted to the RequestLock information

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.DavLockResponseCode.Ok

member.example: If a Depth of 1 is requested

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.DavLockResponseCode.PreconditionFailed
member.remarks: The included lock token was not enforceable on this resource or the server could not satisfy the request in the lockinfo XML element.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.DavLockResponseCode.Locked
member.remarks: If the resource is already locked with an exclusive lock or if the resource is already locked with a shared lock and the client requests and exclusive lock

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavLockBase.DavLockResponseCode.FailedDependency
member.remarks: Implies the action would have succeeded by itself

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase
member.summary: Dav Collection Creation Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_MKCOL
- If the resource identified by the Request-URI is non-null then the MKCOL MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(DavMKColResponseCode.MethodNotAllowed)
- If the resource identified by the Request-URI cannot be a member of a parent collection then the MKCOL MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(DavMKColResponseCode.MethodNotAllowed)
- All ancestors MUST already exist
For example, if a request to create collection /a/b/c/d/ is made, and neither /a/b/ nor /a/b/c/ exists
MKCOL MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(DavMKColResponseCode.Conflict)
Returns DavMKColResponseCode.Created when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Collection Creation Framework Base Class

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.None
member.remarks: Default enumerator value

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.Created
member.remarks: Collection completed successfully

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.Forbidden
member.remarks: This indicates one of two conditions: - The server does not allow the creation of collections at the given location in its namespace - The parent collection of the Request-URI exists but cannot accept members.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.remarks: Can only be executed on a deleted/non-existent resource

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.Conflict
member.remarks: If the parent collection does not exist, or a resource exists with the parent's name but is not a collection

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.remarks: The server does not support the request type of the body

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMKColBase.DavMKColResponseCode.InsufficientStorage
member.remarks: The resource does not have sufficient space to record the state of the resource after the execution of this method.

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Move Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_MOVE
- When the MOVE method has completed processing it MUST have created a consistent namespace at the destination. However, if an error occurs while moving an internal collection, the server MUST NOT move any resources identified by members of the failed collection (i.e., the server must skip this subtree)
For example, if an infinite depth move is performed on collection /a/, which contains collections /a/b/ and /a/c/, and an error occurs moving /a/b/, an attempt should still be made to try moving /a/c/.
Similarly, after encountering an error moving a non-collection resource as part of an infinite depth move, the server SHOULD try to finish as much of the original move operation as possible.
Returns DavMoveResponseCode.Created or DavMoveResponseCode.NoContent when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Resource Move Framework Base Class

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.None
member.remarks: Default enumerator value

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.Created
member.remarks: The source resource was successfully moved, and a new resource was created at the destination.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.NoContent
member.remarks: The source resource was successfully moved to a pre-existing destination resource.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.Forbidden
member.remarks: The source and destination URIs are the same

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.Conflict
member.remarks: A resource cannot be created at the destination until one or more intermediate collections have been created

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.PreconditionFailed
member.remarks: The server was unable to maintain the liveness of the properties listed in the propertybehavior XML element or the Overwrite header is "F" and the state of the destination resource is non-null.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.Locked
member.remarks: The source or the destination resource was locked.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavMoveBase.DavMoveResponseCode.BadGateway
member.remarks: This may occur when the destination is on another server and the destination server refuses to accept the resource.

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavOptionsBase
member.summary: Dav Server OPTIONS Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant / RFC3253 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#dav.compliance.classes http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc3253.html#rfc.section.3.9
Class 1: Class 1 compliant resources MUST return, at minimum, the value "1" in the Dav header on all responses to the OPTIONS method. Class 2: Class 2 compliant resources MUST meet all class 1 requirements and support the LOCK method, the supportedlock property, the lockdiscovery property, the Time-Out response header and the Lock-Token request header. A class "2" compliant resource SHOULD also support the Time-Out request header and the owner XML element.
Class 2 compliant resources MUST return, at minimum, the values "1" and "2" in the Dav header on all responses to the OPTIONS method.
Returns ServerResponseCode.OK when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavOptionsBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Server OPTIONS Framework Base Class

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropFindBase

RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_PROPFIND

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase
member.summary: Dav Resource PROPPATCH Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_PROPPATCH
Instructions MUST either all be executed or none executed. Thus if any error occurs during processing all executed instructions MUST be undone and a proper error result returned.
Returns ServerResponseCode.MultiStatus when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Resource PROPPATCH Framework Base Class

member.name: P:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.PatchedResource
member.summary: Dav resource to apply the property changes

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.None
member.remarks: Default enumerator value

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.Ok
member.remarks: The command succeeded

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.Forbidden
member.remarks: The client cannot alter one of the properties

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.Conflict
member.remarks: The client has provided a value whose semantics are not appropriate for the property. This includes trying to set read-only properties.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.Locked
member.remarks: The specified resource is locked and the client either is not a lock owner or the lock type requires a lock token to be submitted and the client did not submit it.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.FailedDependency
member.remarks: Implies the action would have succeeded by itself

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPropPatchBase.DavPropPatchResponseCode.InsufficientStorage
member.remarks: The server did not have sufficient space to record the property

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Put Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_PUT
- A PUT that would result in the creation of a resource without an appropriately scoped parent collection
For example, if resource /a/b/c/d.html is to be created and /a/b/c/ does not exist
MUST fail with:
base.AbortRequest(DavPutResponseCode.Conflict)
Returns DavPutResponseCode.Created when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Resource Put Framework Base Class

member.summary: Check to see if an existing resource should be overwritten

member.remarks: Default enumerator value

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.DavPutResponseCode.Created
member.remarks: Resource completed successfully

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.DavPutResponseCode.Forbidden
member.remarks: This indicates one of two conditions: - The server does not allow the creation of the resource at the given location in its namespace - The parent collection of the Request-URI exists but cannot accept members.

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.DavPutResponseCode.Conflict
member.remarks: If all ancestor collections do not exist

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.DavPutResponseCode.Locked
member.remarks: If the resource is already locked with an exclusive lock or if the resource is already locked with a shared lock and the client requests and exclusive lock

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavPutBase.DavPutResponseCode.InsufficientStorage
member.remarks: The resource does not have sufficient space to record the state of the resource after the execution of this method.

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavReportBase
member.summary: Dav Version Report Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC3253 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC3253 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc3253.html#METHOD_REPORT
//TODO: update this - If a request body is included, it MUST be a DAV:version-control XML element.
- If a response body for a successful request is included, it MUST be a DAV:version-control-response XML element.
NOTE: There is no way to undo a VERSION-CONTROL command.
Returns ServerResponseCode.Ok when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavReportBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Version Control Framework Base Class

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavReportBase.VersionReportType.ExpandProperty
member.summary: A summary of all the available properties

member.summary: Returns a list of all available property names

member.name: P:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavResourceBase.SupportsExclusiveLock
member.summary: Property detailing if the resource supports exclusive locking

member.name: P:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavResourceBase.SupportsSharedLock
member.summary: Property detailing if the resource supports shared locking

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.ResourcePropertyAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.param: Specify if this property should be included when using reflection

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavUnlockBase
member.summary: Dav Resource Unlock Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC2518 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC2518 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc2518.html#METHOD_UNLOCK
- The UNLOCK method removes the lock identified by the lock token in the Lock-Token request header from the Request-URI, and all other resources included in the lock. If all resources which have been locked under the submitted lock token can not be unlocked then the UNLOCK request MUST fail.
Returns DavUnlockResponseCode.NoContent when successful

member.name: M:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavUnlockBase.#ctor
member.summary: Dav Resource Unlock Framework Base Class

member.example: If the client is not authorized to unlock the resource

member.name: F:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavUnlockBase.DavUnlockResponseCode.PreconditionFailed
member.example: If the client provides a lock token to unlock a resource that isn't locked or provides an incorrect lock token

member.name: T:Sphorium.WebDAV.Server.Framework.BaseClasses.DavVersionControlBase
member.summary: Dav Version Control Framework Base Class
member.remarks:
RFC3253 Compliant
The ProcessDavRequest event must follow the following rules addressed in RFC3253 http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc3253.html#METHOD_VERSION-CONTROL
- If a request body is included, it MUST be a DAV:version-control XML element.
- If a response body for a successful request is included, it MUST be a DAV:version-control-response XML element.
NOTE: There is no way to undo a VERSION-CONTROL command.
Returns ServerResponseCode.Ok when successful
